definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

sentences.english: The queen mother waved to the crowd.
While the Queen Mother was eating dinner, Protestants burst in to demand justice.
sentences.chinese: 正值王太后用餐时，新教徒们冲了进去要求伸张正义。

sentences.english: At the same time Empress Wang sent envoys to Rome …
sentences.chinese: 王太后并曾派人至罗马上书教皇及耶稣总会长。

sentences.english: The queen said to Wang Xiufeng is a marquis.
sentences.chinese: 王太后说给王貅封一个侯爵就是。

sentences.english: He suggested as much to the Queen Mother but met with a negative response.
sentences.chinese: 他向王太后提出这个建议，却收到否定的回应。

sentences.english: Three of her ladies-in-waiting have attested that the Queen Mother did not hate the Duchess of Windsor.
sentences.chinese: 她的三位待侍夫人证明王太后并不憎恨温莎公爵夫人。

sentences.english: The Queen Mother surprised courtiers by suddenly kissing the Duke on the cheek.
sentences.chinese: 王太后突然亲吻了公爵的脸颊，令朝臣大吃一惊。

sentences.english: At the same time Empress Wang sent envoys to Rome for pr…
sentences.chinese: 王太后并曾派人至罗马上书教皇及耶稣总会长。

sentences.english: Queen Mary, the Duke's mother, confined her contact with him to letters.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽王太后，公爵的母亲，克制自己不与他通信联系。

definition: Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC
Princess Taiping (c. 665-713), Tang Dynasty princess, politically powerful and known for her beauty
Li Zhi, personal name of third Tang emperor Gaozong 唐高宗[Tang2 Gao1 zong1], (628-683), reigned 649-683
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
Liu Shi, personal name of Han Emperor Yuandi 漢元帝|汉元帝[Han4 Yuan2 di4]
